instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image / missing 5V LCD enable
threads.message:
This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and seems to work noemally. Board and also the rest of the machine look like new. CPU is getting hot, fan is spinning but no image (on internal LCD and external screen too) I checked: 
<SIGNAL>SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> = 3.4V,
the light on an external mouse is blinkin,
<SIGNAL>S0_LCDBKL</SIGNAL> = 0V.
 noticed no voltage on l8300 and followrd this to <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>. I measured Pin 1,2,5,6 and they are all 0V (coming from the CPU) and they all are not shorted. Pin 8 = 3,34V, Pin 3,7 = 0V. Now i am stuck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image / missing 5V LCD enable
threads.message:
"the light on an external mouse is blinkin"
USB mouse should get steady light.
Else, don't search for image/backlight...
Test in both USB ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image / missing 5V LCD enable
threads.message: Thank you for the answer. I mean that the light is blinkin when the mouse is upside down. So its searching a surface. If i move my finger close to the sensor it stays on... Its hard to see the light on my test moust if ist on the table the right way...Sorry for that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image / missing 5V LCD enable
threads.message:
L8300 should get voltage few seconds at least, when the board starts.
You can check it without LCD even.
If LCD is OK, <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> should reach 2.5V; then L8300 will remain at 3V.
If <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> stays low, L8300 voltage disappears too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image / missing 5V LCD enable
threads.message: Than the problem should be <CHIP>U8340</CHIP>. <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is there at <CAPACITOR>C8340</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R8340</RESISTOR> is <100K OHM, no shorts at Pins 1 & 4 but only 0.2V at Pin 4 and 0V at Pin 1...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image / missing 5V LCD enable
threads.message:
"Than the problem should be <CHIP>U8340</CHIP>"
Why?
<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> comes from display.
<SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> should appear first.
So at least one of <SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL>, or <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> should appear in the first seconds...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image / missing 5V LCD enable
threads.message: I noticed that i cant do a PRAM reset. I connected the speakers (both) but cant get it to chime. But cpu is getting warm and fan is spinning... <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 1.76V. I am really confuesed  by this one. So maybe there cant be an image right now? Both enables (<SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>) are low all the time.
